Package com.saguaro.service

Class GroceryService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.saguaro.service.GroceryService
  • @Service
@Transactional(readOnly=true)
public class GroceryService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a service class providing all logic for grocery list related operations. It is responsible for interfacing with repository interfaces to fetch/persist User entities.
    Author:
    Charles Wong

        Parameters:
        userRepository - a UserRepository instance to support this service
        groceryListRepository - a GroceryListRepository instance to support this service
        groceryItemRepository - a GroceryItemRepository instance to support this service

    • Method Detail

      • getOwnedListNames

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,​java.lang.String> getOwnedListNames​(java.lang.String username)
        Given a username, gets all the grocery lists that the corresponding user owns. Returns the results as a map from list ID to list name.

        Delegates to getListNamesByUsername(String, boolean, boolean).

        Parameters:
        username - the String username of the user to fetch for
        Returns:
        a mapping from list ID to list name of all the lists the user owns

      • getSharedListNames

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,​java.lang.String> getSharedListNames​(java.lang.String username)

        Delegates to getListNamesByUsername(String, boolean, boolean).

        Parameters:
        username - the String username of the user to fetch for
        Returns:
        a mapping from list ID to list name of all the lists the user has shared access to

      • getListById

        public GroceryList getListById​(long id,
                               java.lang.String username)
                        throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Fetch a grocery list, specified by its ID. The list corresponding to the ID, if it exists, is only returned if the provided username corresponds to the owner or one of the shared users of the list. Otherwise, a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        id - a long representing the ID of the grocery list to fetch
        username - the String username of the user making the request
        Returns:
        the found GroceryList object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the provided ID does not match any existing list, or if the user making the fetch request is not authorized to do so

      • createNewList

        @Transactional
public GroceryList createNewList​(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String username,
                                 boolean template)
        Create a new grocery list with the provided name, for the user specified by username. Additionally mark this grocery list as being a template or not.
        Parameters:
        name - a String to initialize the new GroceryList's name with
        username - the String username of the user to create this list for
        template - a boolean specifying whether this grocery list should be a template
        Returns:
        the newly saved GroceryList object

      • createNewList

        @Transactional
public GroceryList createNewList​(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String username,
                                 long templateId)
                          throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Create a new grocery list with the provided name, for the user specified by username. Additionally initialize this grocery list with the items from a template. If the template does not exist, a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown.

        Note that a grocery list cannot have been marked as a template if it is being initalized with a template.

        Parameters:
        name - a String to initialize the new GroceryList's name with
        username - the String username of the user to create this list for
        templateId - a long representing the ID of the template to initialize this grocery list with
        Returns:
        the newly saved GroceryList object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the provided template id to initialize this grocery list with does not exist

      • saveList

        @Transactional
public GroceryList saveList​(GroceryList list,
                            java.lang.String username)
                     throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Given a GroceryList object, attempt to save it as the new state of an existing grocery list. The new list is matched to an existing list using its ID. If a match is not found, or the user making the save request is not authorized to edit the list, a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown.

        Otherwise, the grocery items in the new list overwrite those in the old list completely. Note that this method guarantees that should any items remain unchanged from old list to new list, that the same grocery item reference is kept in the list. Additionally, if a grocery item that already exists in the database needs to be saved to the list, then that instance will be the one saved to the list; new grocery list objects are created and persisted if and only if that grocery item does not already exist in the database.

        If the new grocery list includes and non-null name field, the string contained in that field will overwrite the old list's existing name.

        Parameters:
        list - the GroceryList to save as the new state
        username - the String username of the user making the request
        Returns:
        the newly saved GroceryList object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the new list's ID does not match an existing list that the user is authorized to edit

      • editListName

        @Transactional
public GroceryList editListName​(long listId,
                                java.lang.String newName,
                                java.lang.String username)
                         throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Set an existing grocery list's name to some new string. This method assumes that the username provided must be valid, since a user must be authenticated in order to edit a list's name.

        A ResourceNotFoundException is found in the case where the provided list ID does not match any grocery list belonging to the user with the provided username.

        If the edit is successful, then the newly modified GroceryList is returned.

        Parameters:
        listId - a long representing the ID of the grocery list to edit
        newName - the String to set the name of the grocery list to
        username - the username of the user making the edit
        Returns:
        the newly modified GroceryList object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the provided list ID does not match any grocery list belonging to the user with the provided username

      • removeList

        @Transactional
public void removeList​(long id,
                       java.lang.String username)
                throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Given a grocery list ID, remove the corresponding grocery list if the user making this request is authorized to do so.
        Parameters:
        id - a long representing the ID of the grocery list to remove
        username - the String username of the user making the delete request
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the provided ID does not match an existing list that the user making is an owner of

      • shareList

        @Transactional
public GroceryList shareList​(long id,
                             java.lang.String shareUsername,
                             java.lang.String username)
                      throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Add a user to the shared users of a grocery list. A list can only be shared by the owner of the list, and if the user it is being shared with is a friend of the owner. If any of these conditions are not met, then a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown.

        Furthermore, if the user to be shared with cannot be found, or if the list ID does not match any existing list, a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown. This method assumes that the username of the sharer provided is valid, since a user must be authenticated to call an endpoint that calls this method.

        Parameters:
        id - a long representing the ID of the GroceryList to share
        shareUsername - the String username of the user to share the list with
        username - the username of the owner of the list
        Returns:
        the newly modified GroceryList object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the list to be shared does not belong to the sharer, or if the sharee is not a friend of the sharer

      • unshareList

        @Transactional
public GroceryList unshareList​(long id,
                               java.lang.String shareUsername,
                               java.lang.String username)
                        throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Remove a user from the shared users of a grocery list. This operation can only be performed by the owner of a list. In addition, only users that the list is already shared with can be "unshared" from a list. If the above conditions are not met, then a ResourceNotFoundException will be thrown, with an appropriate error message.

        If the removal was successful, the newly modified GroceryList object is returned.

        Parameters:
        id - a long representing the ID of the GroceryList to unshare
        shareUsername - the String username of the user to unshare the list with
        username - the STring username of the user performing this operation
        Returns:
        the newly modified GroceryList object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the list to be unshared does not belong to the authenticated user, or if the user to be unshared was not part of the shared users of the list
